basics.name: Kawika Naweli
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: Aloha, My name is Kawika Naweli and I grew up in Nanakuli, Hawaii. I'm currently an undergrad studying computer science at the University of Hawaii at Manoa.

work.summary: Developing Main Product For Gidens Team
highlights: Envision and design workflow/design of product.

work.summary: Automated the transfer of 2000+ confidential documents from an SQL database to Confluence using Python and Large Language Models, reducing 300+ hours of manual work and supporting critical processes of over 1000+ employees worldwide.
highlights: Categorized files using an advanced unique sorting algorithm that automatically creates the fileʻs categories by content while filtering out obsolete and empty files.

volunteer.summary: Packed and handed out 100 meals weekly to community families with kids during the summer.

highlights: KSʻs Dual Credit Program under Hawaii Pacific University

awards.title: Hoomau Scholar
awards.summary: Our mission is to provide scholarships, mentorship, and networking opportunities to Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islander (NHPI) students who are active in the NHPI community. By combining the support for academic success and perpetuation of our culture, the foundation will help recipients succeed in their endeavors while maintaining and growing their cultural ties and identity.

awards.title: Paubox Kahikina Scholar
awards.summary: The primary objective of the Paubox Kahikina Scholarship is to encourage Native Hawaiians to pursue careers in STEM or Tech in general.
